message.body: Hi Turner, how are you?
I'm pretty good. Just hit the road with some friends. Headed to upstate new york for the weekend.
Fun... I have no plans.. My life is a little dull lately. Been recuperating from knee surgery...
Yikes! I'm lucky I haven't had to go under the knife for anything like that. ....yet. was it scary?

It was my first surgery... I was terrified. But it went well... I have some wounds from the stitches that are infected and am on antibiotics now... Started physical therapy this week... Most of the pain is gone... I had a torn meniscus
Aww man! That's nuts! That's exactly the sort of thing that makes people so turned off to surgery. I suppose when you need it, you really need it tho.
I was in a lot of pain before the surgery... The pain level is a lot better now... Just the sores hurt and itch... Fun times... But I was walking almostnormal 3 days after surgery
(1/2) I had to to physical therapy when I got hit by a cab on my bike. I separated my shoulder blade but I just stopped going. Seemed like a waste of time
(2/2) cause they didn't have me do anything I couldn't just do myself at home.
There is only one exercise I can't do at home... The exercise bike... And I only can't do it cause I don't have a bike
I feel ya. I couldn't live without my bike. I have about a dozen.
Cool... I need to lose some weight.. Been thinking about getting a bike but no one to ride with ...
Physical therapy is definitely the way to go for most people. Especially if you have health insurance. ....which I unfortunately, do not.
Sorry if I'm distracted. I'm navigating our road trip simultaneously.
No problem... Do you work?
(1/2) Yeah, I work. ...a lot. I'm a courier. I pretty much pick up packages, envelopes, boxes, body parts for operations/testing...etc. pretty much anything
(2/2) from anywhere on the East coast and deliver it anywhere it needs to go.
Interesting... I'm a copy editor... I pretty much read all day
Does that let you work from home then?
Sometimes... I usually work in the office in king of Prussia
Ahhh... Good ole KOP. I deliver there all the time. Well, a few times a week anyway.
How old are you? I'm 34
Cool...
What else do you do up there?
Well... I live near Marcus hook... During the week I just work and go home... Once my knee is better ill go back to volunteering with a cat shelter
Oh nice. We just got a kitten a couple weeks ago.
I have two cats
One is the devil
Ive been looking for a sphynx to adopt for years but they don't really need rescuing pretty much ever.
Ended up getting a Mainecoon. Which is pretty much the exact opposite cause she has so much fluffy long hair, but she is so dang cute! Such a joy.
Ha! Mine has a ton of energy but its just cause she's a kitten. I'm assuming at least.
I hope she doesn't end up being a lil Satan spawn cat.

My female, Rosie, is a calico. My boy, Sunny, is an orange tabby - the other volunteers at the shelter think my boy is part abyssinian.. He's crazy long... Can I send a photo over this text study thing?
Both of my cats are 4 years old.... Sunny and I have the same birthday - march 2
Don't know about the photo but its pretty neat about your birthdays. That's kinda bazaar.
Katniss is only about 3 months old but she's getting so big. I think she grows like every day.
Yep.. They don't stay little long
I tried to send a photo.. Did it go through?
No photo.
Bummer
So.. What are you going to do in NY?
(1/2) Some friends run the upstate NY Etsy.com office and they live on a farm. Every year my bike club has a camping trip over memorial day and this year we're
(2/2) doing it there.
Cool
We have members coming from a bunch of states around the US, but mostly on the East coast.
Neat
(1/2) Yeah, I'm pretty stoked to see everyone in one place. The local chapters get together a couple times a year but this may be the only chance we get to
(2/2) hang with a lot of the farther away chapters.
Cool. I hope you have lots of fun
(1/2) It's kinda like a way funner family reunion. Just imagine hanging and camping and doing anything you want to do with like 100 of your closest friends at
(2/2) once. It's great.
I hope you have a good weekend as well, in spite of your knee.

Thanks... I'm dragging my parents out to look at the Kia Soul... My car is 10 years old... I want my dad there because he knows about cars... I want my mom there because she is legally blind and I take her everywhere so I want to make sure she is comfortable in my next car
We're still 132 miles away. I'm glad I'm not driving. ....for once. I'm behind the wheel 8-10 hours a day. Nice to be a passenger.
I bet!
Aww. That's pretty thoughtful of you.
Hehe... I'm the good daughter
